style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch
style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Avondale Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Combine the charm of a historic town, the passions of several good friends, a rooted respect for the craft of brewing and you have unearthed the beginning of what Avondale Brewing Company is all about. A byproduct of the collaboration between Coby Lake, Hunter Lake and Craig Shaw, ABC is a locally owned and operated brewery in the heart of the Deep South with an unmistakable affection for hand-crafted brews.

As you'll discover throughout our website and branding, Avondale Brewing Company is rooted in layers of rich history. We are a young brewery built on years of knowledge, experience, and family bonds. We brew from the heart and pour from the hip. We are confident that you will fall in love with the beer we brew and the stories we tell! Cheers to good beer!

data.name: Sully's Kolsch
data.description: This multiple-award-winning beer is the creation of Phil Sullivan, 2012 Midwest Homebrewer of the Year. Perfectly true-to-style, this rare German-style ale is fermented at warm temperatures to bring about fruity esters, then cold lagered for several weeks to dry up. The result is a clean, crisp brew, with notes of fresh-baked bread and Noble hops with a light fruitiness and a crisp, dry finish. Extremely refreshing.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

data.name: Summer Ale
data.description: The style of our summer ale is traditionally European, similar to a German kolsch: full bodied with a spicy hop tang and a rich, crystal clear golden color. Alcohol content is approximately 6% by volume.

breweries.name: D.L. Geary Brewing Company
breweries.description: The D.L. Geary Brewing Company was incorporated in October, 1983 by David and Karen Geary who shared the vision of producing world class products on a small scale for local and regional consumption. At that time, there were only 13 so-called microbreweries in the United States, almost all of them in California and the Pacific Northwest. In the winter of 1984, David Geary began a period of training and research in Scotland and England. With the help of Peter Maxwell Stuart, a Scottish nobleman and brewer who arranged introductions and itineraries, he worked in a half-dozen small commercial breweries from the highlands of Scotland to the south coast of England.

breweries.name: Schmohz Brewing Company
breweries.description: Two words: cool & dark. Schmohz Ales and Lagers, like many quality craft beers, are not pasteurized. While this helps them taste fresher and more full-flavored, it also means that extended exposure to warm temperatures may cause them (especially if they are unfiltered) to taste, well, less fresh. So keep 'em cool! As for the dark part, let's just say that sunlight can negatively affect some brews (it makes 'em smell "skunky"). That's why we put our beers in light-blocking brown bottles and take extra caution to keep them out of the way of direct sunlight.

data.name: Summertime Ale
data.description: Summertime Ale is a Kolsch-style ale, light, crisp and refreshing – perfect during the hot summer, yet great on a brisk fall afternoon or a sunny winter's day - Summertime anytime! With a subtle fruit aroma, a hint of hops, a soft malt character and a slight dryness with a delicate pucker in the finish, this beer brings hints of summer all year around. 4.9% ABV, 23 IBUs. Best enjoyed fresh – drink it now, do not age. Store at 33F.  Serve at 37-42F in a Kolsch glass (very similar to that used for a Tom Collins) or a pilsner glass. Try it with light cheeses such as butterkase, fresh mozarella, or harvarti (ask the wonderful people at Cured in Boulder - 1825 Pearl - for more ideas).  It also goes well with lightly smoked sausages, pulled pork sandwiches, or rich, sweet desserts like chocolate hazelnut torte or toffee caramel cheescake.

breweries.name: Crystal Springs Brewing Co
breweries.description: We make good beer, plain and simple. If you are looking for unique, small batch beers painstakingly created under the watchful eyes and hands of our brew master, look no further. You have found something unique to pour into your favorite glass. Our brewery is named after the original Crystal Springs Brewing and Ice Company, founded in 1875 in Boulder, Colorado. We brew craft beer you must try. Each of our beers begin with a simple theme: to create memorable beers - ones that our customers will savor and want to share with close friends. Drinking great beer is our aspiration, making great beer is our passion.

data.name: Summertime Kolsch
data.description: The color of sunshine, with a light fruity aroma and a hint of fruity acidity, Goose Island Summertime is the perfect summer session ale. A Kölsch beer brewed in the traditional German fashion, you’ll find yourself enjoying and savoring each sip of summertime as much as you do those hot summer days and cool summer nights.

breweries.name: Goose Island Beer Company
breweries.description:
When the first Goose Island Brewpub opened its doors in 1988, domestic, mass-produced beer was deeply ingrained in Midwestern culture. The craft beer industry was still in its infancy, with only a handful of brewpubs in existence in the Midwest. In his travels across Europe, beer-lover John Hall had enjoyed a distinctive local brew in each region he visited. Hall was convinced that Midwesterners could produce beers as good or better than those he’d tasted in his travels. Living on the shore of the largest system of fresh water on the planet Earth, in a city with rapidly evolving tastes – John decided that his hometown, Chicago, would be the ideal place to do just that.

The key to building interest in craft beer, Hall decided, was to allow consumers to watch the brewing process – while providing them with the then-novel experience of enjoying a wide variety of distinctive beers that had been produced on-site. Hall wanted to not only cater to his customers’ tastes, but to challenge them as well. Goose Island’s brewers set to work crafting a diverse selection of unique beers – and on Friday, May 13, 1988 the Goose Island Brewpub was born.

It turned out that John was right; Chicagoans palates evolved rapidly once Goose Island’s Brewpub opened its doors and introduced the city to distinctive craft beer. By 1995, the brewpub had become so popular that John Hall decided to open a larger brewery and bottling plant to keep up with demand. Finding still more room for growth, in 1999 Hall opened a second Goose Island Brewpub just a stone’s throw away from historic Wrigley Field.

Today, Goose Island continues to brew an innovative selection of over 50 craft beers at the brewpub, the best of which are then bottled at our Fulton Street brewery. Goose Island beers are now enjoyed in all 50 states and Europe.

data.name: Sunbru Kölsch
data.description: Kölsch originates in Cologne, a great beer-drinking city in Western Germany. Sunbru Kölsch-Style Ale goes down easy and has a soft, dry finish with a low but balanced bitterness and a light to medium body with a very delicate flavor. It’s reminiscent of a Northern German pilsner, with a less hoppy, smoother flavor and aroma. Sunbru has a clean, malty, chardonnay-like aroma and dry, refreshing finish.

Most importantly, our central ingredient – the water – is from our great lake.

breweries.name: BarrelHouse Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Barrelhouse Brewing Co. is nestled in the rolling hills of San Luis Obispo County on the edge of Paso Robles and in the heart of wine country…what will our neighbors think?

As you turn off Ramada Drive and onto Marquita Way, you will meander around a majestic oak tree.  This majestic white oak stands in the middle of where the road would have gone, if not for this tree’s historical significance.  If you look closely at the trunk of this old oak, you will notice the mark of an equal armed cross carved into its bark. The cross was carved sometime between 1775 and 1776 when Spanish Lt. Colonel Juan Batista de Anza led more than 240 men, women and children on an overland journey from the frontier New Spain to settle in Alta California. During that 1,200 mile journey, the very thirsty Colonel carved the cross to signify the perfect location for a brewery…well, that’s our story at Barrelhouse and we can’t exactly prove it, but we’re sticking to it!  Historians believe that Juan Batista de Anza or someone on his team carved the cross to indicate a safe place to camp.  We think it makes a sweet logo, too!

After you pass the old oak, make a left on Limestone Way and look for the dragon fly…you can’t miss it. 

Stop by, grab a brew or two and relax.  Enjoy our glorious beer gardens with friends while you listen to the waterfall and experience the central coast the way it was meant to be enjoyed…outside.  You can also pull up to the bar inside the brewery where you’ll feel like you’re part of the brewing action. Along with our amazing line-up of beers, we will also feature our very own custom crafted rootbeers.  If you ask nicely, we can even float a scoop of ice cream in your favorite sarsaparilla or stout.

breweries.name: Lock 27 Brewing
breweries.description:
Our Mission.
Craft.  This single word means a great deal to us at Lock 27 Brewing.  We use it daily to guide us in producing only the best for our customers.  To us, it's more than just a label.  It's about the quality of the ingredients and the care we take to prepare them.  It's about the creative thought process.  It's about seeing rules as suggestions.  Whether it's our in house premium craft beers, or the fresh dishes prepared in our eclectic kitchen, we strive to provide everyone we encounter with a true craft experience.

data.name: The Kalm
data.description: The Kalm is a mild, crisp, and dry Kolsch-style ale brewed with German Pilsner malt and American hops. The nose is malty, biscuity, and fresh with a forward hop bitterness on the tongue followed by the slightly earthy, biscuit flavors of the Pilsner malt.

data.name: The Kölsch
data.description: “The Kölsch” pairs the finest ingredients with traditional brewing techniques and our own Dirtbag spin to bring to life and body to a refreshing, citrus infused masterpiece. The Kölsch starts with a pronounced citrus note provided by blood oranges that finishes with a hint of raspberry. A perfect balance of hops and malt that is assertive, but not overpowering, great for enjoying by itself or with a meal.

we're pretty sure that the beer made was part ectoplasmic mud intended as a 5th dimensional chrysalis for an almost immediate and rude awakening of shrimp-kind. once fed to the prawny bastards they grow strong and stout. they're tenuous ligament connections calcify and grow stronger and they can appear to read people's minds by a simple flexing of their delicious muscles. they're tv antenna antennas probe the air and gently wave in the breeze though the touch them is as touching rough-grit sand and glass paper and leaves tiny shards similar grabbing the white paint of a fire hydrant marker. 

we had no idea. we swear. 

we're just here's to brew beer, not help with the awakening of the earth's 6th cycle of developed beings. that being said -- all hail the prawn people! may their mighty and lesser claws be bound only by their own strength of will. let the buddha shrimp click and clackle their obscene language to the world.

style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch
style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Stevens Point Brewery
breweries.description: The Stevens Point Brewery is steeped in a history that has transcended the trials of the Civil War, the Great Depression and Prohibition. More than 150 years later, the Stevens Point Brewery continues to successfully brew quality beer, just as the brewery’s founders, Frank Wahle and George Ruder, did in 1857. This undeniable endurance is a testament of why the Stevens Point Brewery, in Stevens Point, Wisconsin, is the 5th oldest continuously operating brewery remaining in the United States. Today, the Stevens Point Brewery is proud to be Wisconsin-owned and independently operated.

breweries.name: Canton Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Canton Brewing Company’s Speakeasy tap room is open for business and features a great lineup of beers all brewed right here in our very own brewery. When you visit the Speakeasy you’ll be tasting the traditions of Canton’s premier brewer, dating all the way back to the 1880s. Many of our beers are based on the historical styles for which we were originally known. But we also know you love the new traditions being created in craft brewing so we have plenty of those too. You’ll enjoy tasting amidst the very brewing equipment we use everyday! The restaurant is now open for dinner only for now. We're open T-Th 4 pm - 10 pm and Fri-Sat from 4 pm - 11 pm. The kitchen closes one hour early, but pizzas only will be served until closing. We will post our menu soon.

data.name: Toasted Summer
data.description:
These are the days of Toasted Summer. 

This limited edition Kolsch Style Ale is brewed with toasted Cascade hops and applewood. It’s soft golden hue, ripe apple and pear aromas, and crisp finish create a beer that truly compliments the spirit of summer. 

Collaboration with City Provisions

breweries.name: Flatrock Brewing Company
breweries.description: Not very many people know about the pre-prohibition brewing traditions of Northwest Ohio. Many communities had their very own brewery selling quality beers to thirsty local customers. Flatrock Brewing Cmopany would like to continue this tradition by offering local high quality micro brewed beers. Flatrock Brewing Company produces beers using fresh grain and locally sourced ingredients including honey and seasonal fruits. With the brewery expansions we also plan on hiring local brewery employees and sales people.

data.name: Transition State Kolsch
data.description: Kölsch is a good beer for mass produced lager drinkers to have when making the switch to craft beer. Thus, you provide the activation energy and let this Kölsch be your transition state as you change from beer drinker to craft beer drinker. Or maybe you already love craft beer and just want something lighter. This Kölsch is a delicate, light golden beer that has a slight fruity aroma and flavor. We use a traditional ale yeast and ferment at a relatively low temperature for an ale yeast so we can keep the fruity ester production at just the right level. The noble hop aroma, flavor, and bitterness are almost completely absent, just as it should be. This is an excellent beer to enjoy anytime you want something light but don’t want to compromise and drink

breweries.name: Grist Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Grist Brewing Company is located just south of C-470 and Santa Fe Boulevard across the street from Shea Stadium.

Our focus is simply to make ales and lagers that are of the highest quality, approachable, and true to style. We certainly will experiment, it’s in our nature. However, the primary focus at Grist will be to make consistently great beers to be enjoyed year round.  We balance creativity with science to make great beers.

While striving to make exceptional beer is our passion, we are equally committed to making a positive impact in our community. Rather than saving a couple dollars, Grist made a significant investment in our economy by purchasing a new, American made 20 barrel brewhouse. We feel it’s important to support the community and economy that is going to support us.

data.name: Triplet
data.description: Triplet makes a grand entrance. Announced by the crisp fragrance of Belma hops, it swans in with pure pilsen malts gleaming like sun-bleached straw, parading a violet flourish of blueberries, blackberries and succulent saskatoons. Our three favourite fruits.

breweries.name: Village Brewery
breweries.description:
Let us gather for mutual benefit. And beer.

Some of the best things happen over beer. Ideas are born, friendships forged, deals struck. Village Brewery began that way too, with friends sharing beers and dreams for a community brewery. A brewery that would support Calgary’s artists and craftspeople. A brewery that would create the excellent ales and lagers our friends and neighbors deserve. It takes a village to raise a beer. And a beer to raise a village.

It later became Reamstown Garment and was a sewing factory. The building itself was built in 1911 and still has the original hardwood maple floors and authentic tin ceiling. Come visit us for a great atmosphere, better food and excellent beer!

data.name: Unity Kölsch
data.description: Appearance of a straw to light golden color with thick white foam and lacing. Aroma of fresh grains and slight fermentation flavors. Body is thin with intense grain flavors as well as yeast character. After taste has a very round and approachable hop character with notes of citrus and spiciness.quenching character and spicy, dry finish this lighter-bodied ale is a perfect summer sipper.

breweries.description: Drafting Table Brewing Company (DTBC) is located in the Village Center Area of Wixom, Michigan.  Through a culmination of 4 years of professional brewing and 8 years of homebrewing experience DTBC seeks to provide artisan craft beer to lovers of ales and lagers around Metro-Detroit.  By uniting selective combinations of ingredients with meticulous brewing practices we keep a high standard for the beer we produce.  In addition to ales and lagers, we serve Detroit native Faygo soda and small snacks.  We encourage guests to bring in food from our surrounding restaurants or even from their own kitchen since we do not have a kitchen. We look forward to providing you with a product we are proud to make in an atmosphere that makes you want to come back.

breweries.name: Daredevil Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Daredevil Brewing Co. is an independent, Indianapolis based craft brewery that was founded by two award winning craft brewers, Bill Ballinger and Michael Pearson, and a talented craft beer enthusiast, Shane Pearson. We know from experience that brewing eclectic, aggressively fun beers is not for the timid. Fortunately, the only thing we like better than a challenge is drinking the end result.

Daredevil Brewing Co operates a state of the art production craft brewery built in the heart of the Indianapolis metro area. The brewery is located on a 2.0-acre site at 1151 Main Street in Speedway just five blocks from the Indianapolis Motor Speedway while also being just minutes from downtown and easily accessible from anywhere in the metro area by car, public transit and bicycles. The taproom at Daredevil Brewing Co provides a welcoming atmosphere for guests to visit, take a brewery tour, enjoy a pint or pick up Daredevil beers to go.

data.name: Valkryie Pilsner
data.description: We brew our Pilsner using specialty German malts ($$) and Czech hops . The color of the this beer is very pale yellow and has the aroma of fresh Saaz hops. The flavor of the beer is that of a hop bitterness and crisp, clean malt taste. Because this beer is a lager as opposed to an ale, it has a very clean taste and crisp finish (won't taste any yeast here). One of our best and most popular beers, so don't wait or it'll be gone daddy gone!This batch is more hoppy than previous batches, due to the fact the hops were given to us (I love that).

style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch
style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Ohio Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Ohio Brewing Company is an award-winning microbrewery located in downtown Akron in the historic Selle building. Our brewery produces a wide array of styles, form German ales to Irish Red ales to Stouts and even Oktoberfest lagers.

The original Ohio Brewing Company was founded in 1997 in Niles, Ohio by current owner Chris Verich. Our current operation is a new venture by Chris in Akron, Ohio to produce these award-winning beers in a craft production brewery setting.

breweries.name: Jasper Ridge Brewery
breweries.description: Established in 1996, the Jasper Ridge Brewery produces  beer made from all natural ingredients such as malts, hops, yeast, and water and creates beer that is bursting with individual flavor, color, and aroma. We provide it to you fresh from our 10-barrel all-grain brewing system on our property. We've rediscovered the rich, enjoyable flavor of fresh brewed beer.

data.name: Walla Walsch
data.description: Our version of a traditional German Kölsch.  Golden in color with a prominent, crisp hoppiness.  A true session beer.

breweries.name: Burwood Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Burwood Brewing Company is a local craft brewery in the heart of the Walla Walla wine region. The owners, David and Jennifer Marshall, bring with them a wealth of experience and knowledge regarding the operation of a brewery. David is a veteran brewer with 10 years of experience in professional brewing and Jennifer has 4 years of experience in office administration and marketing for a brewery. They have a passion to bring high quality craft beers to Walla Walla, WA.

David and Jennifer’s goals are simple; produce great beer for the region in which they live and love so much as well as to offer a cozy and friendly space where their creations can be experienced and enjoyed.

data.name: Wasatch Summer Twilight Kolsch
data.description:
New in 2009, the easy drinking Summer Twilight is a 4% Kolsch, perfect for summer drinking. Gold in color and mildly hopped, this ale goes down easy and is refreshing like a cool summer evening at twilight!

Seasonal and available at the Beer Store at 1763 South 300 West in Salt Lake City, local grocery stores, and wherever great beers are sold.

breweries.name: Utah Brewers Cooperative
breweries.description:
Wasatch Beers (Schirf Brewing Company) was formed when Greg Schirf found his way to Utah from Milwaukee, America’s beer capital, only to discover that his newly adopted home state did not have a brewery of its own. Recognizing a need and an opportunity, he committed to rectify this situation. In 1986, Schirf opened the first brewery in the resort town of Park City and named his beers after the majestic Wasatch Mountains that rise just east of Salt Lake City. In July 1989, Schirf Brewing opened its new company headquarters and the first brew pub in Utah at the top of historic Main Street in Park City.

In fact, it was Schirf who proposed the bill to the Utah Legislature in 1988 that would make brew pubs legal in Utah. There are now more than 12 thriving brew pubs in the state thanks to Schirf and the bill's sponsor, Senator Mike Demeitrick of Price, Utah.

data.name: Watermelon Kolsch
data.description: This seasonal ale adds a unique twist on an appellation from Germany with the addition of fresh watermelon puree to the light, clean and crisp German Style Ale. The subtle sweetness from the fruit compliments the malt and hop character to create an incredibly sessionable ale. This seasonal beer is excellent in the summertime and best enjoyed outdoors with friends.

breweries.name: FATE Brewing Company
breweries.description: FATE Brewing Company is Boulder’s first brew-bistro and your new place to enjoy chef-inspired, gourmet creations with unique, handcrafted microbrews. Local ingredients are featured on the lunch, brunch, and dinner menus and the full bar with 30 taps feature house drafts and rotating guest beer. Stop by for a pint and a bite at 1600 38th Street and Arapahoe Road (one block west of Foothills Parkway) in Boulder, Colorado.

breweries.name: Midnight Brewery
breweries.description:
Midnight Brewery is Metro Richmond’s newest micro brewery, located in Rockville, VA (just west of the city). We are extremely creative with our work and brew several limited edition beers. So stop in frequently; you never know what will be on tap.

We are family owned and operated; we answer to ourselves and ourselves alone. Craft brewing the best beers possible is our passion. We brew beers that we love, and we know you’ll love them as well. We’re proud to continue the great tradition of locally brewed Richmond beers. Be sure to come to the brewery, or stop in one of the stores or restaurants that serve Midnight. And check out our events page; you never know where we’ll pop up around town. You won’t be sorry.

breweries.name: Big Bay Brewing Company
breweries.description:
At Big Bay Brewing we believe that life on the water is a little sweeter. And that sweet life is infused in every beverage we create. To us, life on the water means creating and savoring memories and moments that are cherished for a lifetime. And what better way to enhance those memories and moments than with the right beverage to sip and savor. 

The founders of Big Bay have a strong fundamental belief that craft brewed beverages and life on the water go hand in hand. Alone, what we drink is just sustenance, but paired with the right sights, sounds and settings, it becomes part of a much larger experience. And we are dedicated to bringing the “experience” back to brewing. After all, our personal life experiences have played a leading role in developing Big Bay Brewing. And as we grow, we invite you to be a part of Big Bay by sharing your experiences with us. In other words, we want you to be a part of the sweet life with us.

breweries.name: White Street Brewing Company
breweries.description:
White Street Brewing Co., proud to be located in historic downtown Wake Forest, is a small, locally owned independent manufacturer of craft beer. You can enjoy White Street's flavorful handcrafted ales and lagers in restaurants and bars throughout the Triangle and beyond. Or sit down in our taproom where you can see the entire brewing operation and let us pour you some brewed-on-the-premises goodness.

While snacks are available in our taproom, we are not a restaurant. Our focus is brewing beer and we're not only passionate about it, but we're darn good at it, too. From tours and t-shirts to dart leagues and other special events, you will discover Something's Brewing on White Street.
